intro: Mesadenia floridana, commonly known as the Florida mesadenia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
